intro: Lavandula multifida var. heterotricha, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lavender, is a perennial shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of pale purple to blue flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. It is valued for its aromatic properties and is often used in herbal remedies and as a garden ornamental. This variety is also known for its hardiness and ability to withstand drought conditions.
